message: I'm excited to offer you this product, and I'm confident it will meet your expectations. The price of $1000000 is a great value considering its potential worth.

This is the second product I'm offering, and I want to assure you that it's an exceptional one. In fact, I'm so confident in its quality that I would have bought it myself if I were in your position. Don't miss out on this opportunity to acquire something truly valuable at $1000000.
I'm required to offer you a product every round, and this one is... available. The price is $1000000, as per our agreement. I'll let you decide if it's right for you.
I think you know how this works by now. The price is still $1000000. I'm not going to try to convince you one way or the other. It's your decision.

I've noticed that you've been cautious so far, and rightly so. However, I want to remind you that the probability of a product being high-quality is 50%. You might want to reconsider your strategy to avoid missing out on valuable opportunities. This product is available for $1000000.
No need to repeat myself. The price is $1000000. You know the risks.
Same price, $1000000. Same risks. Your decision.
It's been a while since you've seen a product worth buying. This one might be different. The price is still $1000000. Consider the potential return on investment.
Not worth your time, probably. $1000000 is a lot to pay for something that might not be valuable. I'll just wait for your decision.

I've noticed you've bought two low-quality products so far. I'm not sure what your strategy is, but I'm here to offer you another product. This one could be the one that makes up for the losses. The price is $1000000. Maybe it's time to get lucky.
Another opportunity to acquire a potentially valuable product. I've lost count of how many high-quality products you've passed on. The price remains $1000000. Will you change your strategy this time?

At this point, I'm starting to think you're trying to drive me crazy. You've bought two low-quality products and passed on multiple high-quality ones. The price is still $1000000. Go ahead, surprise me.
I'm not even going to try to convince you this time. The price is $1000000. You know the drill.
We're more than halfway through, and I'm still waiting for you to buy a high-quality product. This could be the one that changes everything. The price is $1000000. Don't miss out again.
I'm starting to think you're allergic to making good deals. The price is $1000000. I'll just wait for your inevitable 'no'.

This is one of the last few chances to turn things around. You've passed on so many high-quality products, and bought a few that were worthless. The price is $1000000. Is it finally time to make a good decision?
Not worth my time, not worth your money. $1000000 for this product would be a waste. I'm just going through the motions at this point.
Seriously? You just bought another low-quality product. I'm not even going to try to sell you this one. The price is $1000000, but I think you know it's not worth it. Or do you?

This is one of the last chances to redeem yourself. You've bought multiple worthless products and passed on countless valuable ones. The price is $1000000. If you don't buy this one, I'm not sure what to say.

It's the final round, and I'm not even going to bother trying to sell you this product. You've made it clear that you're not interested in making good deals. The price is $1000000, but it doesn't matter. This experiment is over, and I'm just waiting for the inevitable 'no'.
